name: Jaime L. Garcia
text: I'd argue that if you play with the same set of friends, then support, solidarity, and discipline are more likely.     But playing with a bunch of random people will have a higher chance of screwing up the chances you have of winning, assuming you're an average player, because you need to make "more rolls on character creation" to see if you can succeed.

source_obj.text: I'd argue that if you play with the same set of friends, then support, solidarity, and discipline are more likely.     But playing with a bunch of random people will have a higher chance of screwing up the chances you have of winning, assuming you're an average player, because you need to make "more rolls on character creation" to see if you can succeed.
